Subjects.Display: Hindu gods; dancing (activity); pennants; female figures; symbols

Locations.Display: Odisha, India (creation); Harvard Art Museums (American art museum), Cambridge, Middlesex, Massachusetts, United States (repository); Stuart Cary Welch (North American art historian, 1928-2008) (former owner)

Note.noteText: Name change implemented by the museum in 2010: Harvard Art Museum changed to Harvard Art Museums. This name change is NOT reflected in LC as of 7/14/2010. This record lists earlier names as alternates. Harvard University Portrait Collection: In October 2007, Harvard University Art Museums made the request to eliminate Harvard University Portrait Collection as a separate repository. The Portrait Collection is now a part of the American department of the Fogg Art Museum. ; Harvard University Art Museums: Name changed from Harvard University Art Museums to Harvard Art Museum in 2008 ; Harvard Art Museum: Name change implemented by the museum in 2010: Harvard Art Museum changed to Harvard Art Museums
For ancient art (Greek, Roman, Etruscan) we have used the Cutter nr. H267 F

aat:AAT.englishScopeNote: Visual works produced by drawing, which is the application of lines on a surface, often paper, by using a pencil, pen, chalk, or some other tracing instrument to focus on the delineation of form rather than the application of color. This term is often defined broadly to refer to computer-generated images as well.

Child.name: visual works by medium or technique

aat:AAT.englishScopeNote: The activity characterized by rhythmical skipping and stepping, with regular turnings and movements of the limbs and body, usually to the accompaniment of music.

tgn:TGN.tgn:Note: Was part of Mughal Empire from 1568; after fall of Mughals, area was divided between Bengal Nawābs and Marāṭhās; both sections eventually went to Great Britain, Bengal section in 1757 and Marāṭhā section in 1803.
